item.title: Brooks's Law
item.description: Definition adding manpower to a late software project makes it later References https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooks%27s_law

item.title: Conway's Law
item.description: Definition Any Organization that designs a system … will produce a design whose structure is a copy of the organization’s communication structure.

item.title: Goodhart's Law
item.description: Definition Adage When a measure becomes a target it seizes to be a good measure. Original Any observed statistical regularity will tend to collapse once pressure is placed upon it for control purposes.

item.title: Hawthorne Effect
item.description: Definition The Hawthorne Effect shows people, when being watched, choose to increase their performance. Many, in error, interpret this to mean more transparency means more productivity.

item.title: Law of Best Choice
item.description: Definition An applicant must be selected on some time interval from an unknown number of rankable applicants. The goal is to maximize the probability of selecting only the best under the hypothesis that all arrival orders of different ranks are equally likely.

item.title: Law of the Instrument
item.description: Definition If the only tool you have is a hammer, it is tempting to treat everything as if it were a nail.

item.title: Little's Law
item.description: Definition it is possible to predict how much time it will take from start to finish to deliver a product, based on the production rate and how much simultaneous Work-In-Progress (WIP) exist in the system

item.title: Parkinson's Law
item.description: Parkinson’s Law Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion References

item.title: Team Performance
item.description: Introduction This case study aims to investigate the challenges faced by a low-performing team in the freelancing industry and the strategies employed to improve team performance.

item.title: Team Performance 2
item.description: Introduction The development of an ERP interface is a complex task, requiring significant resources and time. The ERP Interface Team, consisting of six engineers, was tasked with building a new ERP interface for the company’s product.

item.title: Team Retention
item.description: Introduction Acquisitions are a common occurrence in the business world and can lead to significant changes for employees, including uncertainty, and stress.

item.title: Team Retention 2
item.description: Introduction This study aims to examine the factors that contributed to the retention of one team at a company that operates in the circular economy space, focusing on workplace assets.
